001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.nio.file.Files;
006import java.nio.file.Path;
007import java.nio.file.Paths;
008import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
009import java.util.Comparator;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.stream.Collectors;
012import java.util.stream.Stream;
013import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
014
015/**
016 * Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
017 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
018 */
019public class CoreFileUtils {
020
021    /**
022     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}.
023     * <hr/>
024     * This operation is inversion of standard static methods {@link Path#of(String, String...)}
025     * or {@link Paths#get(String, String...)} - so following expression are identical:<pre>{@code
026     *     pathParts(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
027     *     Stream.of("a", "b", "c")
028     * }</pre>
029     *
030     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
031     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}
032     */
033    public static Stream<String> pathParts(Path path) {
034        return StreamSupport.stream(path.spliterator(), false).map(Path::toString);
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link Stream List&lt;String&gt;}.
039     *
040     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
041     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
042     */
043    public static List<String> pathPartsList(Path path) {
044        return pathParts(path).toList();
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Joining the {@link #pathParts(Path) stream of path components} with {@link File#separator}
049     * - so, the assertions like following are always correct:<pre>{@code
050     *     assertThat(pathPartsStr(Path.of("a/b/c"))).isEqualTo("a/b/c")
051     * }</pre>
052     *
053     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
054     * @return the sequence of {@link Path}-components joining with {@link File#separator}
055     */
056    public static String pathPartsStr(Path path) {
057        return pathParts(path).collect(Collectors.joining(File.separator));
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * The same as {@link #loadFileContent(File)}, but accept the path to that file as {@link String}
062     *
063     * @param pathToLoadStr the path of file to laod as {@link String}
064     * @return the content of that file as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
065     */
066    public static String loadFileContent(String pathToLoadStr) {
067        return loadFileContent(Paths.get(pathToLoadStr).toFile());
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@link String} (it's better to use for text-files only)
072     * and returning {@code null} if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
073     *
074     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
075     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
076     */
077    public static String loadFileContent(File fileToLoad) {
078        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
079            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
080                "could not load the file %s because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
081                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
082        }
083        try {
084            return Files.readString(fileToLoad.toPath());
085        } catch (IOException ignored) {
086            return null;
087        }
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Loading the content of {@code file} as list of lines,
092     * where each line is an element of returning {@link List} of {@link String}.
093     *
094     * @param filePathToLoad path of file to read the content as lines
095     * @return the content of {@code filePathToLoad} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
096     */
097    public static List<String> loadFileLines(Path filePathToLoad) {
098        if (filePathToLoad == null) {
099            throw new IllegalStateException(
100                "the path to file to load lines MUST NOT be null");
101        }
102        try (Stream<String> lines = Files.lines(filePathToLoad)) {
103            return lines.toList();
104        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
105            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
106                "could not load the file '%s' as list of lines", filePathToLoad), ioEx);
107        }
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Saving the content into the file {@code fileToSave} (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated).
112     * All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
113     *
114     * @param fileToSave the file to save into
115     * @param fileContent the content to be saved
116     * @throws IllegalStateException in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)
117     */
118    public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent) {
119        if (fileToSave == null) {
120            throw new IllegalStateException(
121                "could not save the file content, because fileToSave is null");
122        }
123        try {
124            if (fileToSave.getParentFile() != null) {
125                Files.createDirectories(fileToSave.getParentFile().toPath());
126            }
127            Files.writeString(fileToSave.toPath(), fileContent);
128        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
129            throw new IllegalStateException("could not save the content into the file " + fileToSave, ioEx);
130        }
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Copy the file {@code sourceFile} to the file {@code targetFile}
135     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.
136     */
137    public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile) {
138        if (sourceFile == null || !sourceFile.isFile()) {
139            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
140                "could not copy the file %s because it's not a normal file",
141                sourceFile == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + sourceFile + "'"));
142        }
143        if (targetFile == null) {
144            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
145                "could not copy the file '%s' because target file is null", sourceFile));
146        }
147        try {
148            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
149                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
150            }
151            Files.copy(sourceFile.toPath(), targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
152        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
153            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
154                "could not copy the file '%s' into '%s' because of IOException",
155                sourceFile, targetFile), ioEx);
156        }
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * The same as {@link Files#deleteIfExists(Path)}, but ignore any kind of {@link IOException}.
161     * <hr/>
162     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> For non-empty directory the method {@link #removeSilent(File)} should be used,
163     * because this method will always return {@code false} for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
164     *
165     * @param pathToRemove the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
166     * @return {@code true} if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or {@code false} otherwise
167     */
168    public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove) {
169        if (pathToRemove == null) {
170            return false;
171        }
172        try {
173            return Files.deleteIfExists(pathToRemove);
174        } catch (IOException ignored) {
175            return false;
176        }
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
181     *
182     * @param fileOrDirToRemove path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
183     * @return the number of removed items
184     */
185    public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove) {
186        if (fileOrDirToRemove == null) {
187            return -1;
188        }
189        if (!fileOrDirToRemove.exists()) {
190            return 0;
191        }
192        try {
193            if (fileOrDirToRemove.isFile()) {
194                return fileOrDirToRemove.delete() ? 1 : 0;
195            }
196            try (Stream<Path> walkPathStream = Files.walk(fileOrDirToRemove.toPath())) {
197                return (int) walkPathStream.sorted(Comparator.reverseOrder()) // Sort in reverse order to delete contents before directories
198                    .filter(CoreFileUtils::removePathSilent)
199                    .count();
200            }
201        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
202            return -2;
203        }
204    }
205}
